ca.uqac.lif.dag

Interface Connectable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Function
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsoluteValue, Addition, And, AndNode, AtomicFunction, BooleanConnective, Circuit, Constant, ElementAt, Filter, Fork, GetSize, IfThenElse, IsGreaterThan, LabelledNode, Multiplication, NestedNode, Node, Not, NumberCast, Or, OrNode, ParameterizedVectorFunction, PartNode, Split, Subtraction, UnknownNode, VectorAnd, VectorApply, VectorBooleanConnective, VectorFunction, VectorOr, VectorOutputFunction, VectorProduct, VectorSum, Window

    public interface Connectable
    Interface implemented by any object having input and output pins.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToInput(int index, Pin<? extends Node> pin)
      Adds a node's output pin to the set of connections of this node's input pin.
      void addToOutput(int index, Pin<? extends Node> pin)
      Adds a node's input pin to the set of connections of this node's output pin.
      int getInputArity()
      Gets the input arity of the node.
      java.util.Collection<Pin<? extends Node>> getInputLinks(int index)
      Gets the output pins of other nodes that are connected to a given input pin of this node.
      Pin<? extends Node> getInputPin(int index)
      Gets the node's input pin for a given index.
      int getOutputArity()
      Gets the output arity of the node.

      Gets the input pins of other nodes that are connected to a given output pin of this node.

      Gets the node's input pin for a given index.

      Removes a node's output pin to the set of connections of this node's input pin.

      Removes a node's input pin to the set of connections of this node's output pin.
      void setToInput(int index, Pin<? extends Node> pin)
      Sets a node's output pin as the connection of this node's input pin.
      void setToOutput(int index, Pin<? extends Node> pin)
      Sets a node's input pin as the connection of this node's output pin.

    • Method Detail

      • getInputArity

        int getInputArity()
        Gets the input arity of the node. The input arity is the number of input pins of this node.
        Returns:
        The input arity

      • getOutputArity

        int getOutputArity()
        Gets the output arity of the node. The input arity is the number of output pins of this node.
        Returns:
        The input arity

      • getInputLinks

        java.util.Collection<Pin<? extends Node>> getInputLinks(int index)
                                                 throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the output pins of other nodes that are connected to a given input pin of this node.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the current node's input pin
        Returns:
        The collection of output pins of other nodes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is incompatible with the node's input arity

      • getOutputLinks

        java.util.Collection<Pin<? extends Node>> getOutputLinks(int index)
                                                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Gets the input pins of other nodes that are connected to a given output pin of this node.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the current node's output pin
        Returns:
        The collection of input pins of other nodes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is incompatible with the node's output arity

      • addToInput

        void addToInput(int index,
                Pin<? extends Node> pin)
         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Adds a node's output pin to the set of connections of this node's input pin. If other pins are already associated to this input pin, they are kept.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the current node's input pin
        pin - A node's output pin to add to the connections
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is incompatible with the node's input arity

      • setToInput

        void setToInput(int index,
                Pin<? extends Node> pin)
         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Sets a node's output pin as the connection of this node's input pin. If other pins are already associated to this input pin, they are deleted.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the current node's input pin
        pin - A node's output pin to add to the connections
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is incompatible with the node's input arity

      • removeFromInput

        void removeFromInput(int index,
                     Pin<? extends Node> pin)
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Removes a node's output pin to the set of connections of this node's input pin. If other pins are already associated to this input pin, they are kept.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the current node's input pin
        pin - A node's output pin to remove from the connections
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is incompatible with the node's input arity

      • addToOutput

                 Pin<? extends Node> pin)
          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Adds a node's input pin to the set of connections of this node's output pin. If other pins are already associated to this output pin, they are kept.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the current node's output pin
        pin - A node's input pin to add to the connections
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is incompatible with the node's output arity

        pin - A node's input pin to add to the connections
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is incompatible with the node's output arity
